Reviews.Title: “good stay for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: 19Judyk19
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 4 adults and 3 children. Rooms were plenty big although old they were still clean. Internet was a little slow but still did the job. The front desk was very helpful. Would have been nice to have been told about the 200 deposit when we booked but, plenty of space. If you are expecting perfect maybe not for you but if you are not then great place. would definately book again for group setting.

Reviews.Title: “2400 pros and cons...”
Reviews.Author: Darlene C
Reviews.Content: Pros - NO bed bugs (yay); the sheets and towels were clean; the bed was reasonably comfortable; plenty of hot water for shower in morning; even though it is on a main road (Kingsway) it was fairly quiet; staff were friendly, if ineffectual. Cons - VERY old property; the condition of the carpet made me keep my shoes on (it looked greasy); no hot water in the tap in the evening (maybe we didn't let it run long enough? guess 5 minutes wasn't enough...); bathroom sink and tub were chipped and rusty in places; there was no one in the office when we arrived around 11 p.m. - the office staff was out getting food, so we had to wait in the parking lot for about 10 minutes; and the worst of all, the toilet tank leaked into the bowl so every 3 minutes (yes, I timed it) the water would refill in the tank WHOOOOSSHHHH for 8 seconds. After an hour or so of trying to get to sleep I finally got down on my hands and knees and turned off the water line under the toilet. When I told the office staff about it in the morning she said she would have someone look at it, but no, the second night was the same....however, I knew to turn the water off before we climbed into bed. There were also a couple of weird things, like getting the door to unlock, and a strange person in another unit, but that could have happened anywhere. All in all, I don't think I could recommend this place to friends or family, BUT I kind of like the little cabin-like units, on a couple of acres in the middle of a city, and I possibly would stay there again. Maybe. But definitely NOT in unit #134....

Reviews.Title: “mothballs and pinesol with a certain je ne sais qoi”
Reviews.Author: screenname0123
Reviews.Content: Wow, what is that smell? Room 113 had an overpowering chemical smell that gave me a headache. I had to drive home without staying the night. My girlfriend made me wash my clothes upon arrival. Before getting my deposit back the staff member had to check my room for damage, coming back he said he couldn't smell any chemicals. I expected nothing more from him. Well at least the employees are loyal, to the owner. The room was decrepit and someone kept calling and hanging up. Not recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Time Passages”
Reviews.Author: suetripper
Reviews.Content: My family had been coming to this classic court motel since 1973, but this trip will be our last. It really has fallen on bad times. What had been charming and a throwback is now just very worn. Locaiton on Kingsway is still convenient, but carpets and beds are shot, sheets thin. Rat trap behind stove in kitchenette. Cops patrolling parking lot every AM. Yet nothing downscale about price, even though I know Vancouver has gotten more spendy. Staff was helpful with directions and getting more pillows, but this is not a happy place. Nice that they try to have WiFi, but popular such as Facebook sites were blocked by network. Sad to see an institution lose its way like this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Genie65
Reviews.Content: Was a very good motel at one time, when family run. Has deteriorated, not kept up with the times. The best that can be said is that it is a good location, and relatively clean. Out of date now, needs extensive renovating. I am sure there are much better motels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: all_vegas
Reviews.Content: Options for a place to stay for 5 or more people in one room are hard to find but the 2400 motel worked perfect for us. Our room had a living room and a seperate bedroom with 2 beds and room for a rollaway bed, 3 large closets and a good sized bathroom. There was a picnic table right out front of our unit and the lawn was well taken care of including lots of nice flowers and bushes. The units themselves are not fancy but are taken care of as well. We payed $89 a night plus tax and was well worth it. The location is good too. Will stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap but good”
Reviews.Author: joseph1913
Reviews.Content: I think it was cozy, especialy for the price. It is hard to find reasonable accomidation these days. The service was excellant and I would return if traveling again.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE ON KINGSWAY”
Reviews.Author: wetern
Reviews.Content: What a mess, I called for a reservation for 2 adults and my dog (pet Friendly) The person on the phone was having troublr with computer but confirmed my arrival, It was busy when I arrived and told her my name,Put us in a room that had seen better days, (time to get some new matteresses at the least) 2weeks later get a bill for $200.00 saying that the room they put us in was not pet friendly. Talked to a Manager(female) only after she avoided me and tried to have staff tell me they would not reverce charge for something i have no control over. This place is only a money grab and cares nothing about its customers. I recomend that any reader find another place

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: wonderer2009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the 2400 a few times over the years, so when I needed to book a room I called them. We booked a pet freindly room, nonsmoking and were quoted a price of 79$ a night plus tax. Upon arrival we were told we needed to leave a 200$ damage deposit.......and then told us that the room we were to be in was unavailable so had to move us to a bigger one. They then went and locked up the kitchen and second bedroom.....leaving us with bath and one double bed. The room was very cold.......even when we turned the heat up it never got any warmer......over our entire 2 day stay. When checking out ( and being sure to leave our 2 keys as they charge 40$ per key if not turned in) we were informed that there was an addition "pet fee" of 15$ per day..... When I asked why we were not told of this before, we were told that was "just the way it is" The bathtub was chipped baddly and very stained, the tile around the tub showed alot of black mold. The carpets were frayed, and the room smelled baddly. Being on chemotherapy, and having to be cautious of infections, the conditions of this place worried me. If one likes to stay at a place where you are treated like a criminal, and have no concerns about your health or comfort this would be a place for you. For the average person I would steer clear of this place. The service at the check in desk was slow and disorganized, and upon check out the girl working was rude and could have cared less about our complaints. I would never even consider returning to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: pantypolice
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently for a week and was disappointed... Firstly the staff were dishonest about the availability of wireless internet. Instead of just telling me they didn't have wireless internet they told me it should be working and the problem might be my computer. This was not true since it worked when I went to the library. The rooms were old and although roomy since I got a suite with a kitchen. Cleaning service was poor. They didn't even replace the soap everyday. It costs only a few cents for gods sake...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: drummerex
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I stayed at the 2400 Motel in vancouver BC on Kingway.I told the Manager(Blonde male)that I smoked,but that I wouldn't smoke if all they had left was non smoking.He gave us a room #124.Besides the smell in the room(we put up with)75.00 a night.We could not sleep as we were constantly scratching all night. we even put our own blanket on top of the bed,Seems like we were being eaten by bedbugs.In the morning I asked If we could change rooms,the so called manager said they were full up.Amazing when your outside at all hours and you see alot of empty units.The TV was from the 70s,that didn't matter but no picture,I asked the manager if he had another(NOT)When the next dayshift manager came on I asked her if there is a difference between smoking and non smoking rms.She had told me there was and that the price was the same.I asked her if i had said I wanted a non smoking rm That i would have gotten a nicer rm.(she said yes)she had asked If I wanted a different room and that I should have asked that so called manager for a different rm.Which I did ask (supposedly full).I hope he reads this or the owner,actually I know that manager doesn't give a dam.If the owners read this then maybe something will be done with that type of service.He even asked me before if I had smoked,My wife and I sure didn't expect that type of treatment.Word of mouth travels fast and the internet faster,so we'll see.I'll let him sleep or try in that rm#124 and see how he likes it.As always It's Too late for photos as we live in Alberta.I really hope the owners read this.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise chalets”
Reviews.Author: Dontango
Reviews.Content: An open quite well-kept site in a pretty sleazy area - Kingsway could do with some more redevelopment real soon! But easy to find and plenty of space to park. Quite a wide variety of room sizes, worth calling them to find what you need. The chalets are a bit shabby and ours wasn't very clean at first. Old sanitary-ware and low-rent decor didn't help. Neighbors could be heard having a good time starting up ancient motors. But a good location if you want to avoid driving around downtown - you could leave your car and take the bus outside right through to Stanley Park, or the Skytrain from Nanaimo station is 10 mins walk away. Good value though in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “We love this motel”
Reviews.Author: nzbiggles
Reviews.Content: My teenage sons and I stayed here for 4 nights. It was great. Our unit was clean and well equipped. Everything worked which can often be an issue in budget accommodation. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We found being a 10 minute walk from Vancouver's awesome skytrain service was a real asset. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Cutie Pie Vintage Cottages!”
Reviews.Author: amycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 2400 Motel after reading about it in a guidebook while traveling to Vancouver BC. The only reason we wanted to stay here was because it was listed as "inexpensive", with only ONE dollar sign next to it in the hotel listings. We arrived and got a room...which ended up being more like a mini cottage. It was super-adorable. Very retro and cute. If you are not into vintage-y decor, though, you will probably hate it. The room had one bed, a small kitchenette and bathroom. Everything was dated, but not in a bad way...it was more like staying in a "theme" motel...but I suspect the management didn't do that on purpose. Anyway, the most awesome part of the room was a tiny cutout in the wall, made to resemble a "fireplace" with a fake log of wood on a stand that was plugged into the wall in this cutout area. When you turned the device on, there were red and orange lights that rotated in this fake log, which gave the appearance of a pretend fire. It was adorable, and extra-cheezy. I loved this polace and am sad to hear the rumor that it may be shut down! As an added bonus, shortly after we returned from our trip to Vancouver, my husband and I were watching the X Files on television. I know they did a lot of filming of that show in the Pacific Northwest. Anyway, they filmed parts of one episode at this motel. We recognized it right off...well, also the large "2400 Motel" sign that is on the premises was in one of the shots, so that helped us identify the location too. Anyway, that was a neat experience, and I would definitely retun again.

Reviews.Title: “General information”
Reviews.Author: finnishspitz
Reviews.Content: 2400 Motel is a series of free standing cottages, in many you can park outside the door. It is an old establishment, probably from the 1940's - it reminded me of my grandmother's house. It has a good location in terms of accessability to Vancouver attractions. The neighborhood is so-so. Our unit had a separate bedroom with a double bed. The front room had 2 twin beds, a desk and an upholstered chair. We had a kitchen with a full size refrigerator, microwave, small coffee pot, and oven/stove combo. It is not very well equipped, however we did have a skillet and a cutting knife. Bring your own paper plates, napkins, and dish soap. There is no hair dryer. The kitchen doesn't have enough plugs, so we had to plug the toaster and coffee pot in on the dining table in the kitchen which seats 4. It was satisfactory for my family. It is somewhat threadbare looking, but it is clean and the price was right. Some of our fellow guests looked a bit rough. I had read online that there were rumors about the place closing, laments about this motel being the last of its kind, better check this out when making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great set up”
Reviews.Author: flem3547
Reviews.Content: This motel is on Kingsway, one of the main roads in Vancouver but did not have any worrys with noise. It is a little out of downtown but there is good bus and skytrain service.About 10 mins on skytrain to downtown. The unit was bedroom/sitting room, separate bedroom, kitchen and full bathroom. All cutlery and cooking equipment supplied. Found the motel very clean with good staff. Linen was changed daily. Will stay at this motel again no problems.

HotelInfo.Name: 2400 Motel Ltd.
HotelInfo.Address: 2400 Kingsway, Vancouver, British Columbia V5R-5G9, Canada
